required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Device to Assist With Abdominal Access During Laparoscopic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Establish Safety and Ease of Use of a Trocar Placement Access Device (TPAD) for Laparoscopic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and ease of use of a trocar placement access device (TPAD) to assist with obtaining peritoneal access with a Veress needle, and for placing a primary trocar, during laparoscopic surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 minute on day of surgery
primary_outcome.description: The surgeon will complete a LIKERT scale satisfaction survey related to the TPAD to assess its ease of use. Scale range 1-5 (higher scores correspond to higher satisfaction)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time required to obtain peritoneal access and place primary trocar during laparoscopic surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Time from incision to successful placement of primary trocar will be measured and reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Treatment-Related Adverse Events as Assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous from start of surgery through postoperative day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events related to the surgery itself, or to the incision and skin around the incision where the TPAD is placed

arm_group.description: Participants will receive investigational TPAD device during laparoscopic surgery

intervention.description: The TPAD is an experimental device used to assist with placement of Veress needle and trocar during laparoscopic surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >/= 18
- Scheduled for laparoscopic surgery
- Able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18
- Any situation where blind, peri-umbilical passage of a Veress needle is contraindicated.
- Any situation where patients have suspected or confirmed intra-abdominal adhesions involving the peri-umbilical abdominal wall.
- Any situation where patients have a suspected or confirmed umbilical hernia or peri-umbilical ventral hernia.
- Any situation where there is not intact, uncompromised skin of the peri-umbilical region where the device is to be placed.
